The CHI allows connection with the CH to view and download clearing and settlement reports. The reports are available in the popular PDF format. Some of the reports available for the CHI generated at the CH are:
a. Outward Items detailed Report – A comprehensive detailed report that lists each item presented by the CHI on a per session basis
b. Inward Clearing Items - Branchwise Report – A comprehensive detailed report that lists each item received by branches in a bank on a per session basis
c. Outward Items Summary Report – A concise report summarizing items presented by the CHI on a per session basis
d. Inward Items Summary Report – A concise report summarizing items received by the CHI on a per session basis
e. Gross/Net Settlement Report – Report detailing out the settlement position of the bank along with details per payment type on a per session basis
f. Branch Settlement Report – Report that summarizes the outward and inward items for every branch in a bank on a per session basis
g. Pre-Settlement Return Items Report - A comprehensive detailed report that lists each item presented by the CHI that has been returned at the CH before final settlement on a per session basis
h. Clearing House Balance Register Report – A concise report summarizing the settlement position for a bank on a per session basis
i. Duplicate Instruments Report – A comprehensive detailed report that lists the duplicate items sent and received by the CH on a per session basis
j. Clearing Items Extension List – A detail report that list items which have been extended by the CH for a given business date.
k. Inward Returns Clearing Items –Branchwise report - A comprehensive detailed report that lists each return item received by branches in a bank on a per session basis
l. Outward clearing branch wise - contains BOFD branch wise details of presented items.
m. Outward clearing branch wise XLS format - contains BOFD branch wise details of presented items. Format for this report is XLS
n. Outward Items Detailed Report for CPPS– A detailed report of presented items that lists in CPPS. (this report will only be generated for banks opted for CPPS Functionality)
o. Inward Items Detailed Report for CPPS– A detailed report of inward items that lists in CPPS (this report will only be generated for banks opted for CPPS Functionality)
p. Outward Return Items Detailed Report for CPPS– A detailed report of presented Return items that lists in CPPS. (this report will only be generated for banks opted for CPPS Functionality)
q. Inward Return Items Detailed Report for CPPS– A detailed report of inward Return items that lists in CPPS (this report will only be generated for banks opted for CPPS Functionality)

irrelevant.action_point: In para 2 (Definitions) of the Foreign Exchange Management (Foreign Exchange Derivative Contracts) Regulations, 2000, the following definitions shall be added: (xii) 'Contracted exposure' refers to currency risk arising on account of current and capital account transactions permissible under the Act or any rules or regulations made thereunder, that have been entered into. (xiii) 'Anticipated exposure' refers to currency risk arising on account of current and capital account transactions permissible under the Act or any rules or regulations made thereunder, that are proposed to be entered into in future. (xiv) ‘Currency risk' means the potential for loss on account of movement in exchange rates of Rupee against a foreign currency or on account of movement in exchange rates of one foreign currency against another or on account of movement of interest rate applicable to a foreign currency. (xv) 'Hedging' means the activity of undertaking a foreign exchange derivative transaction to manage currency risk. (xvi) 'Exchange traded currency derivatives' means a standardised foreign exchange derivative contract traded on a recognised stock exchange to buy or sell one currency against another on a specified future date, at a price specified on the date of contract.

Member banks must report all cheque related frauds immediately on detection by filling up the CTS Fraud Reporting Form and sending it through email to fraudrisk@npci.org.in. The report must contain the following complete information:
1. Presenting Bank Details: Presenting Bank Name & Branch details, Reporting Person Name, Date of Reporting, and Reporting Person Email ID.
2. Fraud Transaction Details: The Type of Fraud must be specified by selecting from: Counterfeit Cheque/Cheque Cloning (Cloned / Counterfeit cheques are manufactured or printed on non-bank paper to look exactly like genuine cheques but never issued by the respective issuing bank. In most of such cheques the account number does not exist against which these have been issued), Cheque Forgery / Forged Signature (A genuine cheque that has been lost OR stolen and used by a fraudster with a forged signature), Cheque Spot Alteration (When alteration performed on specific locations of a cheque e.g. payee's name OR amount), Cheque Washing (When alteration is performed to erase information from entire cheque), or Others.
3. Details of the Instrument: Account Holder name, Account number, Cheque Number, Customer branch location, Amount, Payee Name, Date of instrument, and TRAN code of instrument.
4. Additional Details: Payee Details (Account Holder name, Account number, ID card number e.g. PAN card, AAdhar number, Driving Licence etc., and Customer since), details of any previous fraudulent cheque deposit in the account, how the fraud was identified, confirmation of whether the cheque leaf was issued by the bank, customer confirmation details for cheque issuance (if taken, including payee and amount), status of the account (dormant or inoperative), details of any customer complaint regarding a lost/stolen cheque, and any other additional details.
5. Authorization: The report must be authorized by the Head of Reporting Department, including their Signature, Name, Email ID, and Contact #.
irrelevant.circular_name: Fraud Reporting to NPCI - Cheque related frauds

irrelevant.action_point: A UCB shall at a minimum provide the relevant details in respect of entries in the accounts as illustrated below: For debit entries related to 'Payment to third parties', the details shall include (i) Name of the payee, (ii) Mode – Transfer, clearing, inter-branch, RTGS/ NEFT, cash, cheque (number), and (iii) Name of the transferee bank, if the payment is made through clearing/ inter-branch transaction/ RTGS/ NEFT. For debit entries related to 'Payment to ‘self’', the details shall include (i) Indicate “Self” as payee and (ii) Name of the ATM/ branch if the payment is made by ATM/ another branch. For debit entries related to 'Issuance of drafts/ pay orders/ any other payment instrument', the details shall include (i) Name of the payee (in brief/ acronym) and (ii) Name of the drawee bank/ branch/ service branch. For debit entries related to 'Bank charges', the details shall include (i) Nature of the charges – fee/ commission/ penalty etc. and (ii) Reasons for the charges, in brief – e.g. return of cheque (number), commission/ fee on draft issued/ remittance (draft number), cheque collection charge (number), issuance of cheque book, SMS alerts, ATM fees, additional cash withdrawals, etc. For debit entries related to 'Reversal of wrong credits', the details shall include (i) Date of the original credit entry reversed and (ii) Reasons for reversal, in brief. For debit entries related to 'Recovery of instalments of a loan/ interest on loan', the details shall include (i) Loan account number and (ii) Name of the Loan account holder. For debit entries related to 'Creation of term deposit/ recurring deposit', the details shall include (i) Term Deposit/ Recurring Deposit Account/ Receipt number and (ii) Name of the Term Deposit/ Recurring Deposit Account holder. For debit entries related to 'Transactions at POS', the details shall include (i) Transaction date, time and identification number and (ii) Location of the POS. For any other debit entries, adequate details on the same lines as mentioned above shall be provided. In case of single debit in account with multiple credits, the payee name/ account number/ branch/ bank shall not be recorded; however, the fact of “multiple payees” will be indicated. For credit entries related to 'Cash deposit', the details shall include (i) Indicate that it is a “cash deposit” and (ii) Name of the depositor – self/ third party. For credit entries related to 'Receipt from third parties', the details shall include (i) Name of the remitter/ transferor, (ii) Mode – Transfer, inter-branch, RTGS/ NEFT, cash, etc., and (iii) Name of the transferor bank, if the payment is received through inter-branch transaction, RTGS/ NEFT. For credit entries related to 'Proceeds of clearing/ collection/ draft etc. paid', the details shall include (i) Name of the draft issuing bank and (ii) Date and number of the cheque/ draft. For credit entries related to 'Reversal of wrong debits (including charges)', the details shall include (i) Date of the original debit entry reversed and (ii) Reasons for reversal, in brief. For credit entries related to 'Interest on deposits', the details shall include (i) Mention if it is interest paid on the Savings Account/ Term Deposit and (ii) Mention the respective Term Deposit Account/ Receipt Number if it is interest paid on Term Deposit(s). For credit entries related to 'Maturity proceeds of term deposit/ recurring deposit', the details shall include (i) Name of the Term Deposit/ Recurring Deposit holder, (ii) Term Deposit/ Recurring Deposit account/ receipt number, and (iii) Date of maturity. For credit entries related to 'Loan proceeds', the details shall include the Loan account number. For any other credit entries, adequate details shall be provided.

A bank shall obtain a ‘Declaration and Undertaking' from a proposed Director / MD&CEO, with appropriate enclosures, requiring the disclosure of the following information:

**I. Personal Details**
1. Name in full (First Name, Middle Name, Last Name).
2. Father's name.
3. Gender (M/F/others).
4. Present address.
5. E-mail address & alternate e-mail address, Telephone Number with STD code, and Mobile Number.
6. Nationality.
7. Date of Birth (dd/mm/yyyy) and Age.
8. Educational qualifications.
9. Director Identification Number (DIN).
10. Aadhaar Number (Optional).
11. a) Permanent Account Number (PAN); b) Charge where the proposed director is assessed to tax (Income Tax jurisdiction)/name and address of Income Tax Circle/Ward; c) Details of filing of return(s) and payment of taxes for past 3 years, including Date of filing and Amount of tax paid (INR).
12. Permanent address.
13. Details in the form of a brief write up on the relevant knowledge or experience in respect of one or more of the matters namely accountancy, agriculture and rural economy, banking, co-operation, economics, finance, law, small scale industry, information technology, payment and settlement systems, human resources, risk management, business management or any other matter the special knowledge of and practical experience of which would in the opinion of the Reserve Bank be useful to the Banking Company.
14. Present occupation (designation, name of the organisation and brief write-up on experience).
15. Previous occupation covering a minimum of the past ten years, with complete address of the organisation(s) worked in, date of joining, date of relieving (including reasons), designation, etc.
16. In case of a Chartered Accountant: a) Membership Number of Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI); b) Date of registration with the ICAI; c) Name and Address of the registered firm/s; d) Details of the Audit(s) presently undertaken by the firm(s) or by the individual.
17. Name of the banker(s) with Branch and Account Numbers (savings/current/loan accounts) where the individual is a primary account holder.
18. Details of shareholding, if held in any entity, either in physical or dematerialized form, by the individual, their spouse, and their minor child (with attached demat/shareholding certificate).
19. Any other information relevant to the directorship of the bank.

**II. Relevant Relationships of proposed director**
20. List of relatives, [as per Section 2(77) of the Companies Act, 2013 and Rule 4 of the Companies (Specification of Definition) Rules, 2014], if any, who are connected with any bank.
21. List of entities in which: a) interested [as per Section 184 of the Companies Act, 2013]; b) holding beneficial ownership [as per Section 89 of Companies Act, 2013 as also the applicable Significant Beneficial Ownership Rules of MCA]; c) acting as a Trustee (also mentioning any other relationship with reference to a trust).
22. List of entities, existing and proposed, in which holding 'substantial interest' within the meaning of Section 5(ne) of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949. 'Substantial interest' means (i) in relation to a company, the holding of a beneficial interest by an individual or his spouse or minor child, whether singly or taken together, in the shares thereof, the amount paid up on which exceeds two crore rupees or such other amount as may be notified in the Official Gazette by the Central Government or ten per cent of the paid-up capital of the company, whichever is less; (ii) in relation to a firm, means the beneficial interest held therein by an individual or his spouse or minor child, whether singly or taken together, which represents more than ten per cent of the total capital subscribed by all the partners of the said firm. The details required include: Name of the company / firm, Country of incorporation, Number of shares, Face Value of each share, Total face value of share holding, Shareholding as % of total Paid up Capital, Beneficial interest (in value as well as % terms), and Whether the entity is a Section 8 Company under Companies Act, 2013.
23. Details of holdings in entities incorporated abroad and having a place of business in India.
24. Name of Bank/NBFC/any other company in which currently or in the past a member of the Board/ Advisor etc. (giving details of period during which such office is being/ was held).
25. If connected with any entity undertaking hire purchase, financing, investment, leasing and other para banking activities (nature of association to be mentioned), details thereof.
26. If a stock broker or connected with any entity engaged in share broking activities, details thereof.
27. Details of fund and non-fund-based facilities, if any, presently availed in person and/or by entities listed in items (21) to (26) above.
28. Cases, if any, where as an individual or the entities listed at (21) to (26) above have defaulted or been declared as a willful defaulter in the past in respect of credit facilities obtained from a bank/NBFC/any other lending institution.

**III. Records of professional achievements**
29. Professional achievements relevant for the directorship.

**IV. Proceedings, if any, against the proposed director**
30. a) As a member of a professional association/body, details of disciplinary action, if any, pending or commenced or resulting in conviction in the past or whether been banned from entry at any profession/ occupation at any time; b) If subject of any written complaint or accusation regarding individual professional conduct or activities, details thereof.
31. Details of prosecution, if any, pending or commenced or resulting in conviction of self or the entities listed at (21) to (26) above for violation of economic laws and regulations.
32. Details of criminal prosecution, if any, pending or commenced or resulting in conviction.
33. If indulged in any breach of AML/CFT guidelines, details thereof.
34. If attracting any of the disqualifications envisaged under Section 164 of the Companies Act, 2013, details thereof.
35. If adjudicated insolvent or has suspended payment or has compounded with creditors, details thereof.
36. If found to be of unsound mind and stands so declared by a competent Court, details thereof.
37. a) If convicted by a Criminal Court of an offence which involves moral turpitude or otherwise, details thereof; b) If convicted by any Court of law, details thereof.
38. If holding any office of profit under any nationalised bank or State Bank of India, except for holding the post of a whole-time director, details thereof.
39. If as an individual or any of the entities at (21) to (26) above have been subject to any investigation/vigilance/ matters of enquiry from any of the previous employers or government departments or agency, details thereof.
40. If found guilty of violation of rules/ regulations/ legislative requirements by customs/ excise/ income tax/ foreign exchange/ other revenue authorities, details thereof.
41. If reprimanded, censured, restricted, suspended, barred, enjoined, or otherwise sanctioned by any regulator such as SEBI, IRDAI, PFRDA etc., professional organisation, government agency, or court because of professional conduct or activities, details thereof. (It shall not be necessary for a candidate to mention orders and findings which have been later on reversed/ set aside in toto, but it would be necessary to make a mention of the same, in case the reversal/ setting aside is on technical reasons like limitation or lack of jurisdiction, and not on merit. If the order is temporarily stayed and the appellate/ court proceedings are pending, the same also should be mentioned).

**V. General Information**
42. If a professional like Chartered Accountant, Advocate etc. and presently undertaking/ undertaken any professional work in any bank, provide details thereof including the name of the bank and period of association with the bank.
43. If a sitting MP/MLA/MLC or holding political position in Municipal Corporation or Municipality or other local bodies, provide details thereof.

**VI. Other Information**
44. In the interest of disclosure and transparency, any other information relevant for assessing 'fit and proper' status must be provided.

The bank must also provide a 'Reason for Rectification'.

The form must be signed by two authorized signatories with their names and designations (with stamp) and include the place and date.

APR will include all charges which are levied by the bank. Illustrative examples of calculation of APR and disclosure of repayment schedule for a hypothetical loan are given below: 
(i) Illustration for computation of APR for Retail and MSME loans
For a sanctioned loan amount of ₹20,000 with a term of 24 monthly instalments of ₹970 each, commencing 30 days post-sanction at a fixed interest rate of 15%, with total fees of ₹400 (₹240 to the bank, ₹160 to third-parties), resulting in a net disbursed amount of ₹19,600 and a total repayment of ₹23,274, the Annual Percentage Rate (APR) must be computed on the net disbursed amount using the IRR approach and reducing balance method, which in this example is 17.07%. The KFS must also detail the schedule of disbursement and the due date of payment.
(ii) Illustrative Repayment Schedule under Equated Periodic Instalment for the above-mentioned hypothetical loan:
The KFS must provide a detailed repayment schedule showing for each instalment: the instalment number, outstanding principal, principal component, interest component, and the total instalment amount.

irrelevant.action_point:
For claim related rectification, a bank must use Form C and provide the following details:

**A. Details of actual, correct and excess claim:**
- The bank must report the 'Actual Claim', 'Correct Claim', and 'Excess Claim' with the 'Date of claim paid'.
- This information must be broken down into 'Interest bearing', 'Non-Interest bearing', 'Other credits', and 'Total' categories.
- For 'Interest bearing', the details required are 'No. of Accounts', 'Principal Amount', and 'Interest Paid'.
- For 'Non-Interest bearing' and 'Other credits', the details required are 'No. of Accounts' and 'Amounts'.
- The 'Total' column must sum up the 'No. of Accounts' and 'Amounts' across all categories.

**B. Details of Excess Claim sent with regular deposit in current month:**
- The bank must report the 'Regular deposit for current month', the 'Excess Claim returned back', and the 'Total Deposit' with the 'Date of deposit'.
- This information must be broken down into 'Interest bearing', 'Non-Interest bearing', 'Other credits', and 'Total' categories, specifying the 'No. of Accounts' and 'Amounts' for each.
- The interest paid in the excess claim (from section A) must be clubbed with the 'Excess claim returned back' in the 'Interest Bearing amount' (in section B).

**Reason for Rectification:**
- The bank must provide a reason for the rectification.

**Authorization and Certification:**
- The form must be signed by two authorized signatories, including their names and designations, with the bank's stamp.
- The form must include a certificate signed by the bank’s Internal/Concurrent Auditors with their stamp, stating: 'Details given above are true as per the records of the bank and verified by me and found to be correct.'

A “nil” report must be sent in case no counterfeit note has been detected during the month. The statement must include:
A. Details of Counterfeit Notes detected: A table with Denomination-wise Details in pieces for FIR and Non-FIR cases.
B. Details of FIR cases filed with police: A table showing the status of FIR cases including those Pending at the beginning of the month, Sent to Police during the month, Returned by Police, and Pending at the end of the month. Each FIR lodged comprises one case.
The report must be forwarded to The General Manager/Deputy General Manager, Reserve Bank of India, Issue Department, and be signed by an Authorised Official with their Name, Designation, and Official Seal.

A bank shall categorize its derivatives portfolio into three fair value hierarchies, viz., Level 1, Level 2, and Level 3 as defined below and disclose the same in the notes to accounts of its financial statements as per template specified in the Reserve Bank of India (Commercial Banks – Financial Statements: Presentation and Disclosures) Directions, 2025.
Level 1 inputs are those inputs which are quoted prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical instruments that a bank can access at the measurement date.
Level 2 inputs are those inputs, other than quoted prices included within Level 1, that are observable for the asset or liability, either directly or indirectly.

In case the overdues arising from forward contracts and plain vanilla swaps and options become NPAs, all other funded facilities granted to the client shall also be classified as nonperforming asset following the principle of borrower-wise classification as per the existing asset classification norms. However, any amount, representing positive mark-to-market value of the foreign exchange derivative contracts (other than forward contract and plain vanilla swaps and options) that were entered into during the period April 2007 to June 2008, which has already crystallised or might crystallise in future and is / becomes receivable from the client, should be parked in a separate account maintained in the name of the client / counterparty. This amount, even if overdue for a period of 90 days or more, will not make other funded facilities provided to the client, NPA on account of the principle of borrower-wise asset classification, though such receivable overdue for 90 days or more shall itself be classified as NPA, as per the extant Income Recognition and Asset Classification (IRAC) norms. The classification of all other assets of such clients will, however, continue to be governed by the extant IRAC norms.

irrelevant.action_point: The foreign shareholding in the small finance bank would be as per the extant Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) policy for private sector banks, subject to the conditions from paragraphs 21, 22, 23, 24 and 25. In the case of such small finance bank which has transitioned from UCB, the promoters shall hold a minimum of 26 per cent of paid-up voting equity share capital at all times during the first five years from commencement of business of the bank, and the Promoters' holding in excess of 26 per cent may be brought down to 26 per cent over a period of 15 years from the date of reaching net worth of ₹300 crore by such UCBs. If the existing NBFCs/MFIs/LABs have diluted the promoters' shareholding to below 40 per cent, but above 26 per cent, due to regulatory requirements or otherwise, RBI may not insist on the promoters' minimum initial contribution; in such cases, the promoters have to ensure that their holding does not fall below 26 per cent of paid-up voting equity share capital during the first five years from commencement of business of the bank, even if fresh equity is infused. At the time of issue of licences, the promoters having shareholding in excess of 40 per cent or 26 per cent of paid-up voting equity share capital, as applicable, shall submit a dilution schedule for bringing down the stake to 26 per cent within 15 years, which will be examined and approved by the RBI. Listing will be mandatory within eight years after the small finance bank commences operations, and any proposed material change (i.e., any change of 10 per cent or above of shareholding) in the shareholding pattern in the promoter entity at the time of application and during the period between the application and grant of license should be reported to RBI.

(a) the additional provisioning for non-performing assets (NPAs) assessed by the RBI exceeds 10 per cent of the reported profit before provisions and contingencies for the reference period. To determine this threshold, UCBs should add back (i) tax expense, and (ii) provisions for standard and non-performing assets (recognised as expenses in their Profit and Loss Account) to their reported net profits for the year.
(b) the additional Gross NPAs identified by the RBI exceed a specified percentage of the reported incremental Gross NPAs for the reference period. The threshold for reported incremental Gross NPAs is 10 per cent for commercial banks, and for Primary (Urban) Co-operative Banks (UCBs), the threshold shall be 15 per cent, which shall be reduced progressively in a phased manner, after review. 'Reported incremental Gross NPAs' refers to additions during the reference year to the Gross NPAs as disclosed in the Notes to the Financial Statements of the reference period.

irrelevant.action_point:
An ARC must obtain the following information and details for any proposed appointee for the position of Director, Managing Director, or Chief Executive Officer, using the prescribed format:
1. Name of the candidate (proposed appointee).
2. Proposed designation/ Type of directorship [Such as Whole-time Director/ Managing Director/ Chief Executive Officer/ Non-executive Director (sponsor/non- sponsor), Independent Director, Nominee Director, etc. (to be clearly specified)].
3. Nationality & Passport No.
4. Date of Birth (DD/MM/YYYY).
5. Address, e-mail ID and phone/mobile number.
6. Permanent Account Number (PAN) and details of income tax returns filed during the last 3 years, including date of filing and amount of tax paid.
7. Director Identification Number (DIN) and current status thereof.
8. Educational/ Professional qualifications.
9. Line of Business or Vocation/ Profession (A brief write-up detailing the relevant knowledge and professional experience of the candidate).
10. Details of bank accounts of the candidate across all jurisdictions, including all accounts such as savings, current, loans and advances, etc., specifying Bank Name, Type of A/c, and A/c Number.
11. Equity shareholding, if any, of the candidate in the applicant ARC, including details of preference shares, compulsorily convertible debentures, etc., if any, separately: (i) Number of shares (ii) Face value of shares (iii) Percentage to total paid-up share capital of the ARC.
12. Whether the candidate is a nominee of or related/associated with any of the sponsor/s, and if yes, details thereof.
13. List of relatives of the candidate, as defined in Section 2(77) of the Companies Act, 2013, who are connected with the ARC (if any), and nature of such connection.
14. Present and past occupations for at least the last 10 years (other than those covered at Sr. No. 15), including Designation/Role, Name and address of the organisation, Employee ID, Tenure (from-to), and Name of the regulator (if regulated by a financial sector regulator in India or abroad).
15. Names of banks, financial institutions (including NBFCs/ ARCs) and other entities in which the candidate has been chairman / managing director / director / chief executive officer, etc., including Name and address of the organisation and its line of activity, Position held, Tenure (from-to), and Name of the regulator (if regulated by a financial sector regulator in India or abroad).
16. List of entities in which the candidate is considered as interested as per Section 184 of the Companies Act, 2013 or holding substantial interest, where 'substantial interest' means the beneficial interest held by an individual or his/her spouse or minor child, whether singly or taken together, in the shares of a company/ capital of a firm, the aggregate amount paid-up on which exceeds ten percent of the paid-up share capital of the company or total capital subscribed by all the partners of a partnership firm, and its regulator.
17. Whether the candidate or the entities listed at (15) and (16) above are or have in the past been in default in respect of any credit facilities (fund/ non-fund-based) obtained from banks/ financial institutions, where 'default' means that the concerned facility has/had been classified as a non-performing asset by the bank/FI. If yes, full details such as name of the lender (including the branch name), type of facility, period and quantum of default, etc. and present status thereof must be furnished.
18. Whether the person is a member of any professional association/ body. If yes, details of disciplinary action against him/ her, if any, commenced, pending or resulting in conviction in the past, or whether he/ she has been banned from any profession/ occupation at any time.
19. Details of civil or criminal prosecution (including under Section 138 (1) of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881), if any, against the candidate and/ or against any of the entities listed in (15) and (16) above initiated, pending or resulting in conviction in the past for violation of economic laws/ regulations.
20. If the candidate has indulged in any breach of AML/CFT guidelines at any time, details thereof.
21. Whether the candidate attracts any of the disqualification envisaged under Section 164 of the Companies Act, 2013, and if yes, details thereof.
22. (a) If convicted by a criminal court of an offence involving moral turpitude, details thereof. (b) If convicted by any other court of law, details thereof along with outcome of such proceedings.
23. If the candidate or any of the entities listed at (15) and (16) above has been subject to any investigation or vigilance/ disciplinary enquiry by any of the previous employers or government departments or agencies, details thereof along with outcome of such proceedings.
24. If the candidate or the entities listed at (15) and (16) above have at any time been found guilty of violation of rules/ legislative requirements by customs/ excise/ income tax/ foreign exchange/ other revenue authorities/ investigative agencies (including issuance of show cause notice), details thereof.
25. If reprimanded, censured, restricted, suspended, barred, enjoined, or otherwise sanctioned by any regulator such as RBI, SEBI, IRDAI, PFRDA, MCA, professional organisations, government agencies or court because of professional conduct or activities, the details thereof. Though it shall not be necessary for a candidate to mention herein about the orders and findings which have been later on reversed/ set aside in toto, it would be necessary to make a mention of the same in case the reversal / setting aside is on technical reasons like limitation or lack of jurisdiction, and not on merit. If the order is temporarily stayed and the appeal proceedings are pending, the same should also be mentioned.
26. If the candidate is a professional (such as a chartered accountant, an advocate, etc.) and is undertaking or has undertaken professional work in any ARC, the details (including the name of the ARC and the period of association) must be provided.
27. Whether the candidate has been declared a wilful defaulter at any time in the last five years by any bank. If yes, details and present status thereof.
28. Whether the number of directorship held by the candidate exceeds the limits prescribed under Section 165 of the Companies Act, 2013/SEBI's (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 (as applicable).
29. Any other information considered relevant for assessing the person as 'fit and proper'.

irrelevant.action_point:
When reporting a fraudulent AePS transaction, the issuer bank must submit an investigation report to NPCI on their letterhead, providing the following details as per the prescribed format:

**1. CASE DETAILS**
A. Date of occurrence of fraud transaction
B. Date of fraud reported by customer

**2. CUSTOMER DETAILS**
A. Full name (mention names of all joint holders, if applicable)
B. Contact number
C. Masked Aadhaar number (masking all other digits of the Aadhaar numbers except the last four digits. For example: **** **** last 4 digits only) (mention Aadhaar numbers of all joint account holders, if applicable.)
D. Residential address including City, State, and PIN CODE
E. Bank branch address

**3. TRANSACTION DETAILS**
A. Correct Aadhaar linking (Y/N)
B. Transaction type {Cash withdrawal, funds transfer, purchase transaction (Aadhaar pay), cash deposit}
C. Number of transactions reported
D. Total amount of reported transactions (in Indian Rupees)
E. A list of transactions with details for each: Transaction date | acquirer ID | terminal ID | RRN number (12 digits as per BCS) | amount | timespan

**4. ISSUER INVESTIGATION DETAILS**
A. Has issuer bank received written fraud complaint letter from customer? (Y/N)
B. Is there any joint holder in customer's account? (Y/N)
C. Is the joint account holder aware of fraudulent transactions reported by the other account holder? (Y/N)
D. Customer's account type (savings/ current)
E. Has the customer shared his/her biometric with any other entity/person for any purpose since the last 06 months? If yes, provide details.
F. Does the customer regularly carry out AePS transactions at same BC/BC agent/CSP locations?
G. Has the customer previously done any AePS transaction in last 06 months
H. How did the fraudulent transaction in the customer account come to the knowledge of the customer?
I. Customer's location at the time of transaction?
J. Was the customer's account statement checked for reported transactions?
K. Any other cases reported against the same BC/BC agent/CSP.
L. Action taken by Issuer Bank to stop subsequent AePS transactions in customer's account.
M. Is Aadhaar number delinked from the customer's account? (Y/N)
N. Is the customer's 'mobile number/ email id' updated in Aadhaar Card? (Y/N)
O. Is the customer's currently used mobile number updated with the bank for SMS alert? Also, was the same number used by customer at time of disputed transaction?
P. Was SMS message sent to customer's mobile number for reported transactions? If "No", provide the reason.
Q. Reason for late reporting of fraudulent transactions by customer (applicable for fraudulent transactions reporting done after 90 calendar days from the date of transaction)
R. Whether Issuer Bank wants to report any other specific details.

**5. FIRST INFORMATION REPORT(FIR) DETAILS**
A. FIR/complaint lodged (Y/N).
B. If "No” provide reason
C. FIR number and date
D. Police station
E. Status of the case

**6. Account details for NEFT (in case of refund consent by acquirer bank)**
A. Name of the issuer bank:
B. Pool account name/ customer name in account:
C. Account number:
D. IFSC code:
E. Name of the branch:

I. What are the login guidelines adopted by the acquirer bank, for authenticating the BC/BC agent/CSP?
J. What are the transaction limits, daily limits set for the BC/BC agent/CSP?
K. Action taken by the acquirer bank to stop subsequent operation by BC/BC agent/CSP.

Banks shall compute the largest annual volatility over a period of last ten years in the following manner: First, daily changes in the foreign exchange rates shall be computed as a log return of today's rate over the previous day's rate. Second, daily volatility shall be computed as standard deviation of these returns over a period of one year (250 observations). Third, this daily volatility shall be annualised by multiplying it by square root of 250. This computation shall be performed on a daily basis for the all the days in the last ten years. irrelevant.action_point:
For settling claims in deposit accounts, releasing contents of safe deposit lockers, or returning articles in safe custody for a deceased customer where a nomination or a joint account with a survivorship clause exists, an RRB shall use a standardized application form as specified in Annex V. This form must include the following sections and require the claimant (*Nominee/Survivor) to provide the specified information and documents:
1.  **Header and Purpose:** The form must be titled 'Application Form for Settlement of Claim...' and clearly state its purpose for cases with nomination or survivorship clauses.
2.  **Claimant's Declaration:** A declaration from the claimant(s) identifying themselves as the Nominee(s), Survivor(s), or the Guardian of a Minor Nominee/Survivor for the accounts/assets of the deceased customer.
3.  **Deceased Customer's Details:** A section to collect the deceased's date and place of death, details of the death certificate (or First Information Report (FIR) and non-traceable report for missing persons), age, marital status, and last known address.
4.  **Details of Claimed Assets:**
    *   For Deposit Accounts: A table to list the nature of deposits (SB/CA/TD), account number, amount, and maturity date for each account.
    *   For Safe Deposit Lockers: The locker number and mode of holding.
    *   For Safe Custody Articles: The receipt number.
5.  **Claimant's (Nominee/Survivor) Details:**
    *   A section to collect the name, address, mobile number, and email address of each nominee/survivor.
    *   For fund transfers, bank account details (Bank Name, Account Type & Number, IFSC) of the claimants must be collected.
    *   For minor nominees/survivors, details of the minor (name, date of birth) and their guardian (name, relationship, address, contact details) must be collected.
6.  **Undertakings:** The claimant(s) must provide the following undertakings:
    *   They will receive the assets in a fiduciary capacity as a trustee for the rightful beneficiaries.
    *   The claimed assets are not subject to any dispute or court order.
    *   They authorize the bank to exercise its right of lien and set-off for any outstanding dues of the deceased.
7.  **List of Attached Documents:** A checklist for the claimant to confirm submission of:
    *   Death certificate (or FIR and non-traceable report for missing persons).
    *   Officially Valid Document (OVD) for identity and address proof of the claimant(s). The form must define OVD as passport, driving licence, proof of possession of Aadhaar number, Voter's Identity Card, NREGA job card, or a letter from the National Population Register.
8.  **Signature Section:** A section for the name and signature (or thumb impression) of all claimants. It must include a note that a thumb impression requires a witness known to the bank, with space for the witness's details and signature.
9.  **Instructional Notes:** The form must include notes such as '*(Delete whichever is not applicable)' to guide the claimant.
10. **Office Use Section:** A designated section marked 'FOR OFFICE USE' for the bank's internal processing.
irrelevant.circular_name: Reserve Bank of India (Regional Rural Banks – Responsible Business Conduct) Directions, 2025

irrelevant.action_point:
A bank shall use the standardised 'Application Form for Settlement of Claim in Deposit Accounts / Release of Contents of Safe Deposit Lockers / Return of Articles in Safe Custody kept by Deceased Customer (cases with Nomination or Joint Account with survivorship clause)' as provided in Annex V. The form must be used to collect the following information and include the specified undertakings and document requirements:
1. A declaration from the claimant(s) identifying themselves as the Nominee(s)/ Survivor(s)/ appointed Guardian of a Minor Nominee/ Survivor for the assets of the deceased or missing customer.
2. Information about the deceased customer, including: Date and Place of Death, details of the Death Certificate, age, marital status, and address.
3. Details of the assets being claimed, including: Deposit Account numbers and amounts, Safe Deposit Locker number, and Safe Custody Article Receipt number.
4. Details of the Nominee(s)/ Survivor(s), including their name, address, mobile number, email address, and bank account details for fund transfer or to whom articles should be released. For minor nominees, details of the guardian must be provided.
5. An undertaking from the claimant(s) stating that:
   (i) They will hold/receive the assets in a fiduciary capacity as a trustee of the rightful beneficiaries.
   (ii) The assets are not subject to any dispute or court order restraining the claim.
   (iii) They authorise the bank to exercise its right to lien and set-off for any outstanding dues of the deceased.
6. The form must list the required documents to be attached: a Death certificate (or FIR and non-traceable report for a missing person) and an Officially Valid Document (OVD) for the identity and address of the claimant(s).
7. The form must define 'Officially Valid Document' (OVD) as the passport, the driving licence, proof of possession of Aadhaar number, the Voter's Identity Card issued by the Election Commission of India, job card issued by NREGA duly signed by an officer of the State Government and letter issued by the National Population Register containing details of name and address.
8. The form must include a provision for the claimant's signature or thumb impression, with a witness required for the latter if the witness is known to the bank.

16.2.3 (i) Debentures/Bonds
All debentures/bonds other than debentures/ bonds which are in the nature of advance should be valued on the YTM basis. Such debentures/bonds may be of different ratings. These will be valued with appropriate mark-up over the YTM rates for Central Government securities as put out by FBIL/FIMMDA periodically. The mark-up will be graded according to the ratings assigned to the debentures/bonds by the rating agencies subject to the following:
(a) The rate used for the YTM for rated debentures/bonds should be at least 50 basis points above the rate applicable to a Government of India security of equivalent maturity,
(b) The rate used for the YTM for un-rated debentures/ bonds should not be less than the rate applicable to rated debentures/bonds of equivalent maturity. The mark-up for the un-rated debentures/bonds should appropriately reflect the credit risk borne by the bank.
(c) Where interest/principal on the debenture/bonds is in arrears, the provision should be made for the debentures as in the case of debentures/bonds treated as advances. The depreciation/provision requirement towards debentures where the interest is in arrears or principal is not paid as per due date, shall not be allowed to be set-off against appreciation against other debentures/bonds.

A non-bank PSO must submit a 'Declaration and undertaking by the Director' to the Department of Payment and Settlement Systems (DPSS), Central Office (CO), RBI, Mumbai, for each new director. The declaration must be dated and include the name of the applicant company / non-bank PSO and provide the following information:

**I Personal details of director**
A Full name
B Date of birth
C Educational qualifications
D Background and relevant experience
E Permanent address
F Present address
G Director Identification Number (mandatory)
H E-mail address / telephone number
I Permanent Account Number under the Income Tax Act and name and address of Income Tax circle
J Any other information relevant to directorship of the company
K Director in the company since (previous details also in case of broken period)
L a) Number of shares held in the company
b) Amount involved (face value of shares held in company in ₹)

**II Relevant relationships of director**
A List of relatives if any who are connected with the company (refer Section 2 (77) of the Companies Act, 2013)
B List of entities if any, in which she / he is considered as being interested (other directorships)
C List of entities in which she / he is considered as holding substantial interest
D Cases, if any, where the director or entities listed in II (b) and (c) above are in default or have been in default in the last five years in respect of credit facilities obtained from the bank or non-bank.

**III Details of some key professional achievements in the areas of**
- Technology and payment system / transaction
- Human resources management / legal
- Accounting / Finance

**IV Proceedings, if any, against the director**
A If the director is a member of a professional association / body, details of disciplinary action, if any, pending or commenced or resulting in conviction in the past against her / him or whether she / he has been banned from entry of at any profession / occupation at any time.
B Details of prosecution, if any, pending or commenced or resulting in conviction in the past against her / him and / or against any of the entities listed in II (B) above for violation of economic laws and regulations and similar statutory provisions of the respective country.
C Details of criminal prosecution, if any, pending or commenced or resulting in conviction in the past against her / him.
D Whether she / he attracts any of the disqualifications envisaged under Section 164 of the Companies Act, 2013 and similar statutory provision of the respective country?
E Has she / he or any of the entities at II (B) and (C) above been subject to any investigation at the instance of government department or agency? If so, give particulars.
F Has she / he at any time been found guilty of violation of rules / regulations / legislative requirements by customs / excise / income tax / foreign exchange / other revenue authorities? If so, give particulars.
G Whether she / he at any time come to the adverse notice of regulators such as SEBI, RBI, IRDA, MCA, etc.
H Whether her / his name appears or has at any time in the past appeared in the list of defaulters as published by CRISIL or whether she / he is connected as guarantor/director with entities which are at default.

**V Any other explanation / information in regard to items I to IV and other information considered relevant for judging fit and proper status of the director.**

The submission must also include the following undertaking signed by the director: 'I confirm that the above information is to the best of my knowledge and belief, true and complete. The banking company shall then forward these details to the Department of Supervision, Reserve Bank of India. The report must contain the following information:
- Name of the banking company
- Date of reporting
- Name of the promoter/promoter group whose shares have been encumbered
- Promoter / Promoter Group holding in the banking company (Number of shares and as a percentage of paid-up share capital of the banking company)
- Promoter / Promoter Group holdings in the bank which are already encumbered (Number of shares and as percentage of total paid-up share capital of the banking company)
- Date of creation / invocation / release of encumbrance (strike off the not applicable event)

- Details of invocation of encumbrance such as name of the person who invoked, number of shares subjected to invocation, etc.
- Post event of creation / release / invocation: Number of shares that continue to be encumbered by promoter and promoter group, and Percentage of paid-up share capital of the banking company that continue to be encumbered by promoter and promoter group.

It has the responsibility to ensure that incidents like fire, theft / burglary / robbery, dacoity, building collapse do not occur in the LAB's premises due to its own shortcomings, negligence and by any act of omission / commission. irrelevant.action_point:
A UCB shall use the standardized application form as provided in Annex V for the settlement of claims in deposit accounts, release of contents of safe deposit lockers, or return of articles in safe custody for deceased or missing customers where a nomination or joint account with a survivorship clause exists. The form must collect the following information and undertakings from the nominee(s) or survivor(s):

1.  **Claimant Declaration:** A declaration from the nominee(s)/survivor(s) or guardian of a minor nominee/survivor regarding their status and the date of death or date since the customer is missing.

2.  **Deceased/Missing Customer Information:**
    *   Date and Place of Death.
    *   Details of Death Certificate (No., date, issuing authority) or, for missing persons, the First Information Report (FIR) and the non-traceable report issued by police authorities. A copy must be enclosed, and the original produced for verification.
    *   Age and Marital Status as on the date of death.
    *   Full address.

3.  **Details of Assets Claimed:**
    *   **Deposit Accounts:** Nature of deposit (SB/CA/TD), Account No., Amount, and Date of Maturity (for TD).
    *   **Safe Deposit Locker:** Locker No., Mode of Holding, and details of articles if known.
    *   **Safe Custody Articles:** Receipt No. and details of articles if known.

4.  **Details of Nominee(s)/Survivor(s):**
    *   Full name, address, mobile number, and email address.
    *   For fund transfers from deposit accounts, the bank name, account type, account number, and IFSC details must be provided.
    *   For minor nominees/survivors, the name of the minor, date of birth, name of the guardian, relationship with the minor, and the guardian's address, mobile number, and email address must be collected.

5.  **Mandatory Undertakings from Claimants:**
    *   An undertaking that they will hold/receive the amount/articles in a fiduciary capacity as a trustee of the rightful beneficiaries and that the settlement shall not affect the rights of such beneficiaries.
    *   An undertaking that the assets are not subject to any dispute or court order restraining the claim or settlement.
    *   An authorization for the bank to exercise its right to lien and set-off for any outstanding dues of the deceased customer.

6.  **Documentation for Verification:**
    *   Death certificate or FIR and non-traceable report.
    *   An Officially Valid Document (OVD) to support the identity and address of the claimants. An OVD is defined as the passport, the driving licence, proof of possession of Aadhaar number, the Voter's Identity Card issued by the Election Commission of India, job card issued by NREGA duly signed by an officer of the State Government and letter issued by the National Population Register containing details of name and address.

7.  **Signature/Thumb Impression:** The form must be signed by the nominee(s)/survivor(s). In case a claimant is unable to sign, their thumb impression must be placed in the presence of a witness known to the bank, and the name and address of the witness must be recorded.

The amalgamated entity shall make disclosures in its first annual accounts post-amalgamation as mentioned below. These disclosures shall continue in the subsequent annual accounts till they are resolved/ closed with concurrence of the Statutory Auditors:
a. Pension liabilities pre and post-amalgamation. The methodology of valuation/re-valuation of the pension liabilities shall be disclosed with details of the increase/ reduction in liabilities as a result of change in pension scheme, if any. This disclosure shall capture details of changes, if any, in pension schemes that are made applicable to the employees of amalgamating banks/ amalgamated bank.
b. Status of vigilance cases and complaints pending in the amalgamating banks as on the date of amalgamation and details of cases that are closed during the year.
c. Status of pending fraud cases, outstanding inter-bank adjustments (amalgamating/amalgamated) and inter-branch accounts and other intermediary accounts post-merger and their impact on the financial statements of the amalgamated bank.
d. Outstanding claims of the amalgamating banks and their members in respect of allotment of shares and time frame for settlement of such claims.
e. Such additional disclosures that may be required by the regulator/ supervisor.

For settlement of claims in deposit accounts, release of contents of safe deposit lockers, or return of articles in safe custody kept by a deceased customer in cases other than nomination or joint account with a survivorship clause, banks shall use a standardized application form which must include the following sections and fields for collecting information and declarations from the claimant(s):

**1. Claimant's Declaration**: A declaration from the claimant(s) stating their claim on the assets of the deceased/missing customer.

**2. Information about the Deceased Customer**:
(a) Date and Place of Death.
(b) Details of Death Certificate (No., date, issuing authority).
(c) Age, Marital Status, Address, and Religion.
(d) Applicable law of succession (e.g., Hindu, Mohammedan).
(e) Details of all legal heir(s) including name, address, age, relation, contact details, and whether they are signing a Letter of Disclaimer/No Objection.
(f) Details of any minor legal heir(s) and their Natural/Legal Guardian.

**3. Details of Claim**:
(a) **Deposit Accounts**: Nature of Deposits (SB/ CA/ TD, etc.), Account No., Amount, and Date of Maturity (in case of TD).
(b) **Safe Deposit Locker**: Locker No., Mode of Holding, and details of articles if known.
(c) **Safe Custody Articles**: Receipt No. and details of articles if known.

**4. Undertakings and Declarations from Claimant(s)**:
(i) An undertaking to hold/receive the amount/payment in a fiduciary capacity as a trustee of the rightful beneficiary(ies).
(ii) An undertaking that the accounts/safe deposit lockers/safe custody articles are not the subject matter of any dispute or Court order restraining the claim.
(iii) An authorization for the bank to exercise its right to lien and set-off for any outstanding dues of the deceased customer.
(iv) An indemnity to hold the bank harmless against any claims, suits, or legal proceedings arising from the settlement.
(v) A declaration on whether a Will was left behind by the deceased.

**5. Basis of Claim**: The claimant(s) must specify the basis of their claim by selecting from the following options and providing the relevant documents:
- Will of the deceased (unprobated).
- Probated Will.
- Letter of Administration.
- Succession Certificate.
- Court decree.
- Legal Heir Certificate.
- Declaration/Affidavit from an independent person regarding the legal heir(s).

**6. Payment/Release Instructions**:
- Details of the claimant's bank account for transferring the balance payable.
- Details of any minor claimant(s) and their guardian.
- Names of persons to whom the contents of the safe deposit locker or articles in safe custody are to be released.

**7. Attached Documents Checklist**: The form must include a checklist for the claimant to select the documents being submitted, including:
- Death certificate (of deceased customer)/ First Information Report (FIR) and the non-traceable report issued by police authorities (in case of missing person).
- Officially Valid Document (OVD) in support of the identity and address of the Claimant(s). The form must define OVD as: “the passport, the driving licence, proof of possession of Aadhaar number, the Voter's Identity Card issued by the Election Commission of India, job card issued by NREGA duly signed by an officer of the State Government and letter issued by the National Population Register containing details of name and address.”
- Will/Probate of Will, Letter of Administration, Succession Certificate, Court Decree/order, Legal Heir Certificate.
- Declaration/Affidavit from an independent person regarding the legal heir(s) of the deceased customer.
- Bond of indemnity signed by Claimant(s).
- Bond of indemnity/surety signed by Third Party(ies).
- Letter of disclaimer/no objection from non-claimant legal heir(s).

**8. Claimant's Signature**: The form must capture the name and signature/thumb impression of the claimant(s). In case a claimant is unable to sign, they may place a thumb impression in the presence of a witness known to the bank.

**9. Notes for Claimant**: The form must include the following notes:
- The bank is not responsible for delays due to incomplete information and may insist on a Legal Document in case of disputes among legal heirs, reasonable doubt about the genuineness of the claimant(s), or if all legal heirs do not join in indemnifying the bank.
- In case of multiple claims, inter se disputes, or a third party producing a Will, the bank shall not settle the claim without an Order/Decree from a Competent Court or a Probate of the Will, and the claim will be kept on hold.

The bank must also have a section 'FOR OFFICE USE' as per its own internal requirements.
irrelevant.circular_name: Reserve Bank of India (Commercial Banks - Responsible Business Conduct) Directions, 2025

irrelevant.action_point:
6.3 FVTPL
(a) Securities that do not qualify for inclusion in HTM or AFS shall be classified under FVTPL. These shall inter-alia include:
(i) Equity shares, other than (a) equity shares of subsidiaries, associates or joint ventures and (b) equity shares where, at initial recognition, the irrevocable option to classify at AFS has been exercised.
(ii) Investments in Mutual Funds, Alternative Investment Funds, Real Estate Investment Trusts, Infrastructure Investment Trusts, etc.
(iii) Investment in securitisation notes which represent the equity tranche of a securitisation transaction. Investments in senior and other subordinate tranches shall need to be reviewed for their compliance with SPPI criterion as per the conditions that the tranche's contractual terms give rise to SPPI cash flows, the underlying pool meets SPPI criteria, and the tranche's credit risk is not higher than the pool's credit risk.
(iv) Bonds, debentures, etc. where the payment is linked to the movement in a particular index such as an equity index rather than an interest rate benchmark.
(v) Securities which are ineligible for classification as HTM or AFS, such as instruments with convertible features, instruments with loss absorbency features (e.g., AT1/T2 bonds), instruments whose coupons do not qualify as 'interest', and preference/equity shares, subject to the exception for equity where the irrevocable option to classify at AFS has been exercised.
